title: Mass Effect director Casey Hudson's "AAA" sci-fi game cancelled, studio closing
description: Humanoid Origin, the studio founded by former Mass Effect director Casey Hudson in 2021, is ending development of its untitled sci-fi game and shutting its doors, after an "an unexpected shortfall of funding left [it] unable to sustain operations." Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Amazon's releasing individual trailers for its Secret Level show if you're curious about that Concord episode
description: Amazon's intriguing Secret Level anthology series is almost upon, bringing 15 episodes of brand-new stories set in familiar video game worlds. And following on from its recent series trailer, Amazon is now releasing individual teasers for each episode, offering a closer look at the likes of Spelunky, Unreal Tournament, and, of course, that posthumous turn for Concord. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: PS5-Exclusive Action Game Rise Of The Ronin Drops To $30 For Black Friday
description: Rise of the Ronin, the latest action-RPG from Team Ninja, is available for only $30 at Amazon and Walmart. The $40 discount is part of Walmart's Black Friday Sale, and Amazon, as it usually does, is matching the offer. But heads up: Amazon is estimating orders placed now to arrive in... February 2025. So, yeah, you might want to buy it at Walmart instead. Rise of the Ronin $30 (was $70) See at Walmart See at Amazon Stellar Blade Standard Edition $50 (was $70) See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Best Buy Rise of the Ronin is a fast-paced action game set during a pivotal moment in Japanese history. As an outside agent, you'll run into real-life historical figures, occasionally battle them, and help influence Japan as it enters a new era. Like other Team Ninja games, Rise of the Ronin has Souls-like combat, but it's surprisingly approachable and rewarding when you master the way of the blade and several other weapons."It's not without some flaws, but I finished Rise of the Ronin with much more left to do, and even after 50 hours, I want to head back in to see what I'd missed and attempt to change history," Phil Hornshaw wrote in GameSpot's Rise of the Ronin review. "The parts of the game that work more than balance out its weaker elements. And while it took a while to find the rhythm of Rise of the Ronin's combat, its speed, complexity, and intensity make for some phenomenal fights that always feel great to win. Rise of the Ronin is a game that might take a bit to get good, but the commitment is worth it."Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom On Sale For Over 50% Off At Walmart
description: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom $30 at Walmart | $40 at Best Buy & Target See at Walmart See at Best Buy See at Target Tears of the Kingdom Collector's Edition Guide $26.85 (was $45) | Eligible for Buy Two, Get One Free See at Amazon PowerA The Legend of Zelda Wireless Controller $25 (was $45) See at Amazon The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is one of the Switch's must-play games, and now it's available for a new low price just one day after achieving its previous low price. Walmart has Tears of the Kingdom for only $30--10 bucks less than it'll cost you at Best Buy and Target. Walmart's deal isn't likely to stick around for long, so interested adventurers should snag it while you can. You can also get the newest entry in the series, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, for $45 (was $60). If you need a console for these two Zelda games, Walmart has Switch OLED and Switch holiday bundles for $50 off.Walmart has a bunch of other notable Nintendo Switch game deals, too:Animal Crossing: New Horizons -- $30 ($60)Kirby and the Forgotten Land -- $30 ($60)The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom -- $45 ($60)The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom -- $30 ($70)Nintendo Switch Sports -- $30 ($50)Nintendo World Championships -- $25 ($30)Pikmin 4 -- $30 ($60)Pokemon Legends Arceus-- $45 ($60)Super Mario 3D World + Bowserâ€™s Fury -- $30 ($60)Super Mario Maker 2 -- $30 ($60)Super Mario: Odyssey -- $30 ($60)Super Monkey Ball Banana Rumble -- $25 ($50)You can check out Best Buy's and Target's Nintendo Switch deals below.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Xbox Is Shutting Down the Avatar Editor App and Offering Refunds Starting in January

title: Thieves Steal $1.5 Million Worth Of Oculus VR Headsets

The outfits are all locked behind different means, whether itâ€™s story progression, amiibos, or side quests. Below [â€¦]
author: Julia Lee

title: If Amnesia: The Dark Descent were actually Amnesia: The Dark Ascent, it would be White Knuckle
description: Many are the horror games that involve you going down. Down is where much of the Badness in the world is traditionally located, after all, whether you're talking about geology or psychology or theology. White Knuckle reverses the flow. You are already Down; by extrapolation, you must now go Up. Possibly, you are Down because you are a manifestation of the aforementioned Badness. Possibly, the monstrous things trying to thwart your ascent are merely trying to stop you contaminating the surface world. Possibly, they are the Real Heroes. It doesn't really matter, because you don't have a choice. There is a wall of unspeakable flesh coming up the tunnel behind you. To avoid becoming part of it, you must climb. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 858
description: Soâ€¦what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isnâ€™t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. Itâ€™s just a list of more or less random questions Iâ€™ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Stuffing or mashed potatoes? Both speak volumes to my carb-loving heart, but I love mashed potatoes just a little bit more. 2. Apple pie or apple cider? Um, both? 3. Do you have any Thanksgiving day traditions? Not really, although I do short circuit if I donâ€™t get at least one slice of pecan pie. I gotta have it! 4. Have you ever hosted Thanksgiving? Yes, a handful of times, and yes, there was pecan pie. HAHAHA! 5. Something youâ€™re thankful for? So thankful to spend time with my little family of El Hub, Connor, Rosie and Marnie. Our house is full and so is my heart! Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen P.S. Here are the questions to copy/paste with your answers in a comment. Talk[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 858 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839
description: As most people know, Tabs was a demanding employer. He was also very fair to his employees. More than generous, actually. In keeping with his holiday traditions, Rosie allowed us to take the next two weeks off (thank you so much, Rosie!). Consequently, the employees of Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC have been up to their vacation shenanigans, which for me meant blogging while dressed up as a cat lady lumberjack. Makeup, of course, has been on Connorâ€™s agenda, but sheâ€™s still perfecting her techniqueâ€¦ Marnie has been cruisinâ€™ the streets of Novato looking for tiny dogs with short legs to bark at â€” that is, when Connor isnâ€™t demanding that they play dress-up together. Weâ€™ve all been enjoying this joyful break before Thanksgiving. I hope things are going well with you, too. Weâ€™re here and weâ€™re feisty (just tired). ðŸ˜Š Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
